p: We evaluated the action of tylosin on biofilm growth in vitro. The MIC against S. suis was 0.5 μg·mL −1. Tylosin at 1/2 MIC and 1/4 MIC caused a significantly higher reduction in the biofilm-forming ability of S. suis compared with positive control ( p < 0.05). However, there was no pronounced effect for 1/16 MIC and 1/8 MIC of tylosin on biofilm formation of S. suis ( p > 0.05; Figure 1).
